results.title: Horse breaking
results.creator_credit: Agrifilm and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Depicts 72 year-old Kel Jeffrey applying his unique and humane method of gaining a horse’s confidence to the point where it will allow a saddle to be placed on its back and a person to ride it.
results.description: Depicts 72 year-old Kel Jeffrey applying his unique and humane method of gaining a horse’s confidence to the point where it will allow a saddle to be placed on its back and a person to ride it.

results.title: The Work prejudice film
results.creator_credit: Ray Rivas, Allan Frank Sandler and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description: Investigates the stereotypes surrounding the world of work relevant to an American situation. Documentation and humour are used to motivate the young person who faces 25 to 45 years in the workforce. Narrated by Robert Vaughn. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray Rivas, Allan Frank Sandler and Sandler Institutional Films

results.title: But you're a girl
results.creator_credit: Sue Johnston, Julie Ruth and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: Shows some of the areas girls have traditionally worked in are no longer certain providers of jobs and then goes on to look at other job options such as trades, apprenticeships and traditionally male dominated professions. Indicates that is is possible for girls and young women to enter these areas, do well in them and enjoy them.

results.title: Better life than them
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A group of 15 year olds are interviewed about their attitudes towards school, employment and unemployment and life expectations, peer group acceptance, short and long term prospects of jobs and careers.

results.title: The Volunteer Youth Program
results.creator_credit: Jack White, Andrew Scollo and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Highlights the depressing effect that prolonged unemployment can have upon a young person’s self-confidence and that involvement in community work can provide an opportunity for people between jobs to exercise a sense of choice in their career. Explains the resources of the Volunteer Youth Program providing a sample of the range of activities - theatre, public radio and child care.

results.title: Up against it
results.creator_credit: Cath Cantlon and Henley Beach Mural Collective
results.brief_description: A documentary on the painting of a large mural on a sea wall at Adelaide’s Henley Beach. Shows the design considerations, research, the process of involving the local council and school students, and the preparation and painting of the wall.

results.title: Devrim
results.creator_credit: Amelia Flores, Mandy King, Zynet Kesting and Migrant Women's Film Group
results.brief_description: Looks at the situation of a young Turkish woman who finds herself in an impossible marriage. Explores her dilemmas, her conditioning both as a migrant and as a woman, and shows how she eventually deals with these. The program is told from a migrant’s perspective, having been written, produced and directed by a group of six migrant women from different countries and backgrounds. Raises issues about migrant women’s lives in Australia, particularly domestic violence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amelia Flores, Mandy King, Zynet Kesting and Migrant Women’s Film Group

results.title: Theatre: getting your act together
results.brief_description: Presents a behind-the-scenes look at the theatre and the roles of the playwright, director, actor and theatre production staff. Designed to promote students’ interest in the theatre and to provide them with an insight into the workings of two professional theatre companies - The Melbourne Theatre Company and Sydney’s King O’Malley Theatre Company. The program is divided into five sections: 1 What is theatre? 2 The playwright in society. 3 In rehearsal. 4 The performance. 5 Theatre in society.

results.title: Not Crippled, Not Useless
results.brief_description: Michael Briffa is fourteen and will probably be confined to a wheelchair for the rest of his life. This program explores Michael’s determination and success in being allowed to enrol in an ordinary school. As well, Michael’s parents discuss their attitudes to special schools.

results.title: Aussie assault
results.creator_credit: Harvey Spencer, Bill Scholer, Garry Holt and Sportmaster Programs
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the work and preparation that went into Australia II winning entry in the America’s Cup. Shows the crew at leisure as well as at work.
